# `CREATE2` Deployer

[![Test smart contracts](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/create2deployer/actions/workflows/test-contracts.yml/badge.svg)](https://github.com/pcaversaccio/create2deployer/actions/workflows/test-contracts.yml)
[![License: MIT](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-blue.svg)](https://opensource.org/license/mit/)

Helper smart contract to make easier and safer usage of the [`CREATE2`](https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-1014) Ethereum Virtual Machine (EVM) opcode. `CREATE2` can be used to compute in advance the address where a smart contract will be deployed, which allows for interesting new mechanisms known as _counterfactual interactions_.

<div align="center">
  <img src="assets/img/distribution.jpg" alt="A very fancy meme" width="80%" />
</div>

## Unit Tests

Since [Hardhat](https://hardhat.org) implements great features for Solidity debugging like Solidity stack traces, `console.log`, and explicit error messages when transactions fail, we leverage [Hardhat](https://hardhat.org) for testing:

```console
npm run test
```

### Test Coverage

This project repository implements a test coverage [plugin](https://github.com/sc-forks/solidity-coverage). Simply run:

```console
npm run coverage
```

The written tests available in the file [`Create2Deployer.test.ts`](./test/Create2Deployer.test.ts) achieve a test coverage of 100%:

```console
--------------------------------|----------|----------|----------|----------|----------------|
File                            |  % Stmts | % Branch |  % Funcs |  % Lines |Uncovered Lines |
--------------------------------|----------|----------|----------|----------|----------------|
 contracts\                     |      100 |      100 |      100 |      100 |                |
  Create2Deployer.sol           |      100 |      100 |      100 |      100 |                |
  Create2DeployerDeprecated.sol |      100 |      100 |      100 |      100 |                |
--------------------------------|----------|----------|----------|----------|----------------|
All files                       |      100 |      100 |      100 |      100 |                |
--------------------------------|----------|----------|----------|----------|----------------|
```

> **Important:** A test coverage of 100% does not mean that there are no vulnerabilities. What really counts is the quality and spectrum of the tests themselves.

## Deploying to a new chain

This contract is deployed to its canonical address at `0xF49600926c7109BD66Ab97a2c036bf696e58Dbc2` across many chains.
It is deployed using `CREATE2`, using Zoltu's [deterministic-deployment-proxy](https://github.com/Zoltu/deterministic-deployment-proxy) at `0x7A0D94F55792C434d74a40883C6ed8545E406D12`.
To deploy, simply send a transaction to `0x7A0D94F55792C434d74a40883C6ed8545E406D12` with the following bytecode as calldata:
```

```

Example `foundry cast` command:
```bash
cast send --rpc-url <RPC_URL> --private-key <PRIVATE_KEY> 0x7A0D94F55792C434d74a40883C6ed8545E406D12 
```

To verify, ensure your network is added to `hardhat.config.ts`, then use `hardhat-verify`:
```
npx hardhat verify --network <YOUR_NETWORK> 0xF49600926c7109BD66Ab97a2c036bf696e58Dbc2
```

## Deployments [`Create2Deployer`](./contracts/Create2Deployer.sol)

- **EVM-Based Production Networks:**
  - Ethereum: [`0xF49600926c7109BD66Ab97a2c036bf696e58Dbc2`](https://etherscan.io/address/0xF49600926c7109BD66Ab97a2c036bf696e58Dbc2)
  - Base: [`0xF49600926c7109BD66Ab97a2c036bf696e58Dbc2`](https://basescan.org/address/0xF49600926c7109BD66Ab97a2c036bf696e58Dbc2)
- **Ethereum Test Networks:**
  - Goerli: [`0xF49600926c7109BD66Ab97a2c036bf696e58Dbc2`](https://goerli.etherscan.io/address/0xF49600926c7109BD66Ab97a2c036bf696e58Dbc2)
- **Additional EVM-Based Test Networks:**
  - Optimism Testnet (Goerli): [`0xF49600926c7109BD66Ab97a2c036bf696e58Dbc2`](https://goerli-optimism.etherscan.io/address/0xF49600926c7109BD66Ab97a2c036bf696e58Dbc2)
  - Base Testnet: [`0xF49600926c7109BD66Ab97a2c036bf696e58Dbc2`](https://goerli.basescan.org/address/0xF49600926c7109BD66Ab97a2c036bf696e58Dbc2)
